strsep.c

00031 
00032 #include <u/libu_conf.h>
00033 #include <string.h>
00034 
00035 #ifndef HAVE_STRSEP
00036 /*
00037  * Get next token from string *stringp, where tokens are possibly-empty
00038  * strings separated by characters from delim.  
00039  *
00040  * Writes NULs into the string at *stringp to end tokens.
00041  * delim need not remain constant from call to call.
00042  * On return, *stringp points past the last NUL written (if there might
00043  * be further tokens), or is NULL (if there are definitely no more tokens).
00044  *
00045  * If *stringp is NULL, strsep returns NULL.
00046  */
00047 char *
00048 strsep(stringp, delim)
00049         char **stringp;
00050         const char *delim;
00051 {
00052         char *s;
00053         const char *spanp;
00054         int c, sc;
00055         char *tok;
00056 
00057         if ((s = *stringp) == NULL)
00058                 return (NULL);
00059 
00060         for (tok = s;;) {
00061                 c = *s++;
00062                 spanp = delim;
00063                 do {
00064                         if ((sc = *spanp++) == c) {
00065                                 if (c == 0)
00066                                         s = NULL;
00067                                 else
00068                                         s[-1] = 0;
00069                                 *stringp = s;
00070                                 return (tok);
00071                         }
00072                 } while (sc != 0);
00073         }
00074         /* NOTREACHED */
00075 }
00076 
00077 #else
00078 char* strsep(char **, const char *);
00079 #endif 
00080
